page.title: 12Government - Parish Council
page.content: Gorran Parish Council is made up 10 elected parishoners,representing the wishes of the residents.Elections take place every 4 years,there are no restrictions on the number of people standing as nominees.The Parish Council was set up in 1894,previously Parish affairs were settled by wealthy landowners.Some of the problems of the last century - poor sewerage,cliff falls,water supply - still recur. The present Council levy a rate of 1 to 2p in the pound on all rateable properties in the Parish. The rates collected are used for the maintenance of footpaths,cemeteries, and other local amenities. The Parish Council works closely with the District Council and Cornwall County Council - they meet on the first Thursday of each month in the Church Rooms.
